cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.DC

The paper deals with the problem of inexact synchronization in supervisory control systems, which involves the interaction between a plant and its controller. This problem is related to the verification and refinement of closed loop systems, which are typically modeled using process algebra. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), which deals with formal methods for reasoning about the behavior of systems. 

The paper also introduces a communication medium to address the problem of inexact synchronization, which involves the interaction between different components of a system. This aspect is related to the sub-category cs.PL (Programming Languages), which deals with the design and implementation of programming languages and systems. 

Moreover, the paper deals with the problem of supervisory control, which involves the coordination and management of different components of a system. This aspect is related to the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control), which deals with the analysis and design of complex systems. 

The paper also proposes a solution based on automatic synthesis, which involves the use of algorithms and heuristics to generate correct and efficient systems. This aspect is related to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which deals with the development of intelligent systems and algorithms.
